meanings.definition: To pass or go over again
meanings.sent1: After finishing the book, she decided to repass the chapters to better understand the story.
meanings.sent2: I need to repass the bridge to get back to the other side of the river.
meanings.sent3: He had to repass the same test three times before finally passing it.
meanings.sent4: The idea kept coming back to him, like a song that you can't stop humming.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile would repass his mind every time he closed his eyes.

meanings.definition: To pass again through a process or procedure
meanings.sent1: The chef had to repass the dish through the oven to make sure it was cooked perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Please repass your application through the proper channels for approval.
meanings.sent3: He had to repass the security check after forgetting his phone in the tray.
meanings.sent4: The document had to repass several levels of review before being accepted.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to repass the obstacle course to beat his previous time.

meanings.definition: To pass again in thought or consideration
meanings.sent1: She would often repass the events of that day in her mind, trying to make sense of it.
meanings.sent2: Let's repass our options before making a final decision.
meanings.sent3: He would repass his mistakes, hoping to learn from them and not repeat them.
meanings.sent4: The idea would repass his mind like a shadow, always present but never fully seen.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter would repass his thoughts, bringing a smile to his face.
